I was trying to do a thing and it went w: I was trying to do a thing and it went wrong. It may be a temporary issue and if you try again it could work - great!
It didn't work when I tried again: It didn't work when I tried again
See if your problem is described on the: See if your problem is described on the list of outstanding {{link}}Redirection issues{{/link}}. Please add more details if you find the same problem.
If the issue isn't known then try disabl: If the issue isn't known then try disabling other plugins - it's easy to do, and you can re-enable them quickly. Other plugins can sometimes cause conflicts, and knowing this in advance will help a lot.
If this is a new problem then please eit: If this is a new problem then please either create a new issue, or send it directly to john@urbangiraffe.com. Include a description of what you were trying to do and the important details listed below. If you can include a screenshot then even better.
Important details for the thing you just: Important details for the thing you just did
Please include these details in your rep: Please include these details in your report
Sorry but something went wrong loading t: Sorry but something went wrong loading the data - please try again
Delete the logs - are you sure?: Delete the logs - are you sure?
Once deleted your current logs will no l: Once deleted your current logs will no longer be available. You can set an delete schedule from the Redirection options if you want to do this automatically.
Thanks for subscribing! {{a}}Click here{: Thanks for subscribing! {{a}}Click here{{/a}} if you need to return to your subscription.
Want to keep up to date with changes to: Want to keep up to date with changes to Redirection?
Sign up for the tiny Redirection newslet: Sign up for the tiny Redirection newsletter - a low volume newsletter about new features and changes to the plugin. Ideal if want to test beta changes before release.
I deleted a redirection, why is it still: I deleted a redirection, why is it still redirecting?
Your browser will cache redirections. If: Your browser will cache redirections. If you have deleted a redirection and your browser is still performing the redirection then {{a}}clear your browser cache{{/a}}.
Can I open a redirect in a new tab?: Can I open a redirect in a new tab?
It's not possible to do this on the serv: It's not possible to do this on the server. Instead you will need to add {{code}}target="blank"{{/code}} to your link.
Please disable all other plugins and che: Please disable all other plugins and check if the problem persists. If it does please report it {{a}}here{{/a}} with full details about the problem and a way to reproduce it.
Need some help? Maybe one of these quest: Need some help? Maybe one of these questions will provide an answer
You've already supported this plugin - t: You've already supported this plugin - thank you!
I'd like to donate some more: I'd like to donate some more
You get some useful software and I get t: You get some useful software and I get to carry on making it better.
Please note I do not provide support and: Please note I do not provide support and this is just a donation.
Thank you for making a donation!: Thank you for making a donation!
Delete the plugin - are you sure?: Delete the plugin - are you sure?
Deleting the plugin will remove all your: Deleting the plugin will remove all your redirections, logs, and settings. Do this if you want to remove the plugin for good, or if you want to reset the plugin.
Once deleted your redirections will stop: Once deleted your redirections will stop working. If they appear to continue working then please clear your browser cache.
Manage all your 301 redirects and monito: Manage all your 301 redirects and monitor 404 errors.
Redirection is free to use - life is won: Redirection is free to use - life is wonderful and lovely! It has required a great deal of time and effort to develop and you can help support this development by {{strong}}making a small donation{{/strong}}.
Here you can import redirections from an: Here you can import redirections from an existing {{code}}.htaccess{{/code}} file, or a CSV file.
This will be used to auto-generate a URL: This will be used to auto-generate a URL if no URL is given. You can use the special tags {{code}}$dec${{/code}} or {{code}}$hex${{/code}} to have a unique ID inserted (either decimal or hex)
A unique token allowing feed readers acc: A unique token allowing feed readers access to Redirection log RSS (leave blank to auto-generate)
I'm a nice person and I have helped supp: I'm a nice person and I have helped support the author of this plugin.
Use groups to organise your redirects. G: Use groups to organise your redirects. Groups are assigned to a module, which affects how the redirects in that group work. If you are unsure then stick to the WordPress module.
Sorry, but your redirection was not crea: Sorry, but your redirection was not created.
WordPress-powered redirects. This requir: WordPress powered redirects. This requires no further configuration, and you can track hits.
For use with Nginx server. Requires manu: For use with Nginx server. Requires manual configuration. The redirect happens without loading WordPress. No tracking of hits. This is an experimental module.
Uses Apache {{code}}.htaccess{{/code}} f: Uses Apache {{code}}.htaccess{{/code}} files. Requires further configuration. The redirect happens without loading WordPress. No tracking of hits.
Automatically remove or add www to your: Automatically remove or add www to your site.
If you want Redirection to automatically: If you want Redirection to automatically update your {{code}}.htaccess{{/code}} file then enter the full path and filename here. You can also download the file and update it manually.
Unable to add new redirect - delete Redi: Unable to add new redirect - delete Redirection from the options page and re-install
Invalid source URL when creating redirec: Invalid source URL when creating redirect for given match type
You can only redirect from a relative UR: You can only redirect from a relative URL (%s) on this domain (%s).
Source and target URL must be different: Source and target URL must be different.
Name: Name
The visitor will be redirected from the: The visitor will be redirected from the source URL if the user agent matches. You can specify a matched target URL as the address to send visitors if they do match, and not matched if they don't match. Leaving a URL blank means that the visitor is not redirected. All matches are performed as regular expressions.

The visitor will be redirected from the source URL if the referrer matches. You can specify a matched target URL as the address to send visitors if they do match, and not matched if they don't match. Leaving a URL blank means that the visitor is not redirected.
The target URL will be chosen from one o: The target URL will be chosen from one of the following URLs, depending if the user is logged in or out.  Leaving a URL blank means that the user is not redirected.
